website_summaries.verdict: While it's still a great prosumer dSLR, the D7100 may only be worth the extra cash if you need a faster Nikon right now.
pros: The Nikon D7100 is a fast-shooting, well-designed camera that's comfortable to use
cons: While the image quality is quite good, it's not significantly better than that of the D7100's cheaper sibling, the D5200
And the lack of aperture control in movie mode gets a facepalm

customer_reviews.title: Bought w/o warranty, it died today.
customer_reviews.text: I got great pics at two air shows and had been quite happy as it replaced a D-7100 I dropped and destroyed. Today I made sure I had two charged batteries and the PNY Elite 64GB chips I use. Much to my dismay, the camera turned on yet would not take a picture in any mode or setting. Even the video would not work. The mirror would not retract either. I changed batteries, no help. I removed the SD cards, no help. The display on top turns on yet no autofocus action and no way would it take a picture. I now have two bookends that say NIKON D 7100. I was a fool.
customer_reviews.author: Drunk_Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am new to digital photography and pleased with my new Nikon. I had an old film Nikon and wanted to be able to use older AF lenses which won't work on some Nikon models. This camera has lots of features and can be used with both built in modes for easy shooting or with full manual control of the options for the more adventitious. It is not the latest model in this series so it is available at a more affordable price, and has the qualities I have come to expect from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: James Claiborn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: An amazing camera for the price! Especially if you really know how to use it and control it! Would recommend for sure! I’ve had mine (refurbished model) for over 3 years and it continues to preform! Weather proofing is pretty amazing too! But I wouldn’t recommend getting it too wet!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This camera is excellent. I bought this camera for my wife after ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is excellent. I bought this camera for my wife after trying the Nikon 3400 which was not NEARLY as good. This is a nice solid camera for the money. It has good features, battery life, and dual slots are very handy. This camera takes wonderful photos and it was great to get the package with two lenses
customer_reviews.author: Reuben

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are excellent --of course much depends on the lens
customer_reviews.text: My primary camera is a D800. I purchased this to replace an aging D90 that I use as my second body. No complaints with the D7100. Pictures are excellent --of course much depends on the lens. I used this mostly with the Tamron 18-270 mm VC lens for travel/touring (landscapes), family pictures, and aviation photography. I have also used it with the Nikon 10.5 Fish Eye, as well as the Nikon 12-20 mm fF4.0. Exposures are perfect and high ISO performance is excellent. The shutter is quieter than the D800. It has been a reliable performer to-date.
customer_reviews.author: Jehan Ghouse

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying my first real camera! The lense that came with it has a couple nicks in it tho 😔 The lease is also doesnt give me the crisp results I hoped for. Results are better outdoors in natural lighting though. Can't wait to purchase a new lense and see what it can do!
customer_reviews.author: kayb

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this camera! I did a lot of research and had originally decided on the 3300, then I went to the 5500, and so glad I ultimately chose this one. I haven't quite figured out manual mode, but I shoot in aperture priority mode and set my f stop and my ISO, then let the shutter speed adjust automatically. I use a 50mm 1.8g for right now, and hoping to get a wide angle lens and/or an 85mm. I've only done portrait photography so far. I'm not super impressed with the quality in low light, I know the 7200 would have done better. But this was the best I could get with my budget.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for 360 panoramic shooting and general outdoor photographers
customer_reviews.text: Clearly the mid-range camera to get for bracketing needs for virtual tour photographers. I shoot a 5-frame bracket in Nikon RAW mode (NEF) and I can set 1/3 or 1/2 stop increments apart. Very sensitive CMOS sensor lets me capture a lot more range than with the Nikon D7000. Ideal for entry level photographers new to VPiX 360 photography -- this Nikon is easy to learn with intuitive, and approachable controls that you can learn in a single weekend. From setting the F-stop to 8.0, to shooting your first VPiX 360 panorama... this is the model to get if you don't have the budget for a Nikon d610 or Nikon D800 series camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bartley Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon D7100 Excells
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D7100 is an excellent camera. I recently upgraded from a D90 to the D7100. I mainly shoot video to upload to Youtube, so I needed the flexibility of the D7100. Now I can easily add an external mic, use manual focus Ai lenses, and shoot 1080p as well. The video output from the D7100 is a huge improvement over the D90 video output; so for anyone with a camera that is 2 generations behind like the D90 you will become very happy by moving up to the D7100.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Years ago
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Years ago, trained on film format. Frankly reluctant to enter the digital age of photography. However if one understands the principles of photography, the transition to digital is an adventure. The d7100 offers the full spectrum from point and shoot to creative expression. I think it is one of the best if not the best digital cameras out there to include the more expensive ones. Don't be intimidated by the camera and what it can do ...... Grow with it by using it!
customer_reviews.author: David B. Shoby

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, almost as good as my D600
customer_reviews.text: I also have a D600, and there is not a lot of difference between the two. If you are debating between the two and money is no object, go for the D600, but if it would hurt you financially, get the D7100. One of the few differences is that the noise kicks in a little sooner. With the D600, the noise at ISO 100 vs 200 vs 400 is imperceptible to me so I routinely shoot at 400. With the D7100, I default to 200. ISO 800 on the D600 is about the same as ISO 400 on the D7100, and it's not bad, but I stay below that if I don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a D80. I wish I could say the transition has been easy. The functions the camera offers are WAY more advanced than my D80. The images I've captured are tack sharp. The clicks are smoother. The camera feels good in my hand. Word of advice. Keep the user's manual close. Find some instructional videos on Youtube. I love the camera. Just wish I had more time in the day to learn how to use the darn thing!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: Nikon fixed everything I didn't like about the D90. The camera supports to SD cards, and has a lock for the camera settings. I was always hitting the dial at top and changing the settings. The pictures and exposure are excellent. I'm still learning the camera but am very happy. This camera is also moisture resistant and has a magnesium body and not plastic like the D90. I went out in my backyard fooling around with my Macro lens and was astounded at the pics I captured. I usually take 200 pictures and like a handful. I took 20 pics and really loved 5 which never happens.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Parisi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera - As a working professional photographer I just ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera - As a working professional photographer I just replaced a D300 with this model and will be buying another for back-up
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera is very good even in late 2019 I use this for small jobs with a sigma 17- 50mm works very well, image quality is good even at high iso 1600-2500 no complains would never sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Step Up from the D90
customer_reviews.text: It's very much like my d90, but a major step up! LOVE this camera. Only downfall is the shutter button. It made sound stupid, but the d90 had a definitive "click" when you pressed it. This is a softer, cheaper pressurized shutter button. I think it's more sensitive, and ultimately better, just prefer the old style. If that is my only complaint though, then that says it all. P.s. I do get great low light performance out of this camera, and low grain at higher ISO then the d90.... BUT I don't think it is AS GOOD as they say it is in some reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Essmaker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera deal!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great deal!! it was bought by me as "Used" but other than not having the manual it was like brand new! I also saved money by purchasing used, body only..however, at best buy I saw one with the lens for about the same price. Im really happy with this camera! Of course, I really needed to upgrade from my D50! I decided on this D 7100 because of having more pixels and a "Bracketing" option! I feel i couldnt have chosen a better camera or a better price!
customer_reviews.author: Johnnybigfish

customer_reviews.title: This is what I think makes this camera so great. On the minus side
customer_reviews.text: Well now, the photos are remarkably clear, crisp and colorful. Through a broad spectrum of light conditions. This is what I think makes this camera so great. On the minus side, however, is its complexity -- a complexity that does allow it to work well in so many conditions. I love this camera, but after taking pictures with it for a month I realize that I have just begun to learn how to use it. I recommend that buyers of this camera also purchase separate books on how/why to use its so-many settings.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I don't dislike anything. Fact is though that the D7200 is the better camera for a few reasons. The D7200 is better in low light and is faster among a couple other things. HOWEVER, for the money this is a good deal. Better than most others in it's class.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tons of Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most expensive camera I have ever bought but it's definitely worth it. The camera menu is very easy to learn and use while all the functions (and there are many) take a little longer to learn and get used to. For the price, you get a whole lot of camera and it's excellent that it comes with the extra lens as well! I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone who wants something professional and not exorbitantly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Your Forte Products

customer_reviews.title: It is a great camera, in my estimation
customer_reviews.text: My first DSLR, bought after recommendation by someone whose opinion I respect. So much to learn, but I'm getting there. It is a great camera, in my estimation, and is able to far outdo my current talents! (I did a lot of photography with film in the '60s--80's) It is a bit heavy, but that ain't bad; a well-made tool should not be flimsy. It seems that there is nothing I can't do, if I want to do it, and I look forward to a long time with this "machine!" Most of the controls are---or adapt to---an intuitive location so that I don't have to keep learning where the button or control is. I like that.
customer_reviews.author: P. Yavner

customer_reviews.title: takes great pics even in Auto Mode
customer_reviews.text: Solid performer. It's easy to get lazy with this camera as it is very forgiving - just place it in Auto Mode for great pictures. Picture quality is usually excellent - good exposure, focus, etc. Battery lasts all day.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D S

customer_reviews.title: 7100 exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Stepping up to this model from a 3100 has been a massive pleasure. I love the 2 memory card feature! Instant backups, or save Raw AND Jpeg on 2 different cards. The features are numerous and there's nothing this thing can't handle. I had recently picked up a Rokinon tilt-shift lens and it pairs so well with this camera that I am blown away by the power and clarity of the device. This is NOT a beginner's camera, it is a power user's dream though. NIKON knocked this one out of the park! WELL DONE
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great choice of bundle, great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This was the exact right bundle for me to buy. The case is much bigger than I expected, but as it turns out, I needed a case this size. The camera is fantastic and not too difficult to figure out. I didn't think I needed the memory card, but when I discovered the camera has TWO SD card slots, I was glad to have a backup (and a spacious one at that). The 18-140mm lens is a great all-around standard lens and the 55-300 makes a dandy telephoto. I haven't even bothered to look at the CD, to be honest. Overall, though, this was totally a fantastic decision on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best camera for the money. I do miss my d300 it has a similar image quality as the d700. This one is nice in the shade but for different exposures as in the shadow differences you will have to edit in post production to bring Bach the shadows information. For 24 megapixels that's the perfect amount for anything. The function buttons are a little cramped and after 4 years I don't really use any presets. I just adjust everything in full manual.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Sisouvanh

customer_reviews.title: Great quality shots
customer_reviews.text: Great quality shots. I find that the user interface is not intuitive on any of the Nikon or Canon bodies.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Gorog

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon D7100 is a fantastic camera. At 24
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D7100 is a fantastic camera. At 24.1MP, I've printed at 24x36 and the results look at least as good as what you'd expect from 35mm film. With the right lens and lighting, this gadget can render useful prints and very detailed images. If you shoot sports, though, you may want to get the D7200, which is otherwise the same except for a larger cache of images when shooting in CH mode. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: omgsh I love love love love this camera can't stress the word ...
customer_reviews.text: omgsh I love love love love this camera can't stress the word love enough. the company did an excellent job getting me the camera before the expected date. Also it included things I wasn't expecting. which was a total blessing. camera came in it original packaging. A must buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dakkia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera that has provided great shots while backpacking through the country.
customer_reviews.text: Have had a blast getting used to and learning this camera. Limited experience with the product thus far but have been so impressed with the shots I have gotten, even though I barely know what I am doing. I have this camera teamed with an additional 35mm prime lens and love it. Also, this is a very sturdy camera. I have taken it on many backpacking trips where it has held up extremely well. it definitely has some war wounds to prove it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: A bit more than I bargained for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that would produce digital pictures with the same clarity and detail as a 35mm film camera. This camera will do exactly that with the 24 MP resolution. My former camera was a Nikon D40. The camera itself is not as easy to use as earlier Nikon models but once one goes through the manual and steps through the desired features the end product is superb. As with most things, one has to work through some of the "glitches" to become familiar with the camera. Then it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Papaorca

customer_reviews.title: The image quality is excellent with either a Nikkor 24-120 f4 G or a ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an ancient D100 with this D7100. I am very please with the versatility and adaptability of this camera. The image quality is excellent with either a Nikkor 24-120 f4 G or a Tamron 90mm f2.8 VC macro. Having cut my teeth on fully manual cameras 40 years ago, the huge array of auto modes and sophistication is a bit much, but the technology produces exceptional results. I suggest buying one of the auxiliary instructional books and taking the time to explore and learn the capabilities of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a D3100.. AMAZING. I love the extended ISO levels. I love the fact that so many controls are easy to change just by holding a button and rotating a dial (ISO, metering, Aperture, shutter speed) I love the fact that theres a little screen at the top that lights up so you can see settings in the dark. This is a GREAT camera. Im still playing with it, but.. WOW!
customer_reviews.author: DeluXXXe

customer_reviews.title: The camera feels so much better, and it lets you access its features faster
customer_reviews.text: I went from the D5100 to the d7100, and had so many doubts regarding the fact that there arent any "major" differences between them. My main motivation for upgrading were the second dial, the extra buttons, the size of the camera, the fact that it is a little faster, and the extra lcd screen at the top. After 6 months since i bought the d7100 i can confidently say: it was well worth it. The camera feels so much better, and it lets you access its features faster, wich ultimately results in being able to take the right picture at the right time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it works OK
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera second hand from Amazon. Seems like it works OK. What bothers me most is that it didn't come with the camera's printed manual. Rather a CD for Nikon software and a one sheet for a lens that I don't have. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: No One

customer_reviews.title: It's an amazing camera, what can I say
customer_reviews.text: It's an amazing camera, what can I say? Coming from a Pentax K-5II, I found the Nikon larger, heavier and more complicated and am still working through how to use it. If you're not willing to put some time into this camera save your money and buy something else. But, if you will do your homework (also purchased "Mastering the Nikon D7100) you will get some amazing shots. Now i would like to get some more lenses. Better start saving...
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: this camera is amazing i love the sharpness the super quick autofocus built ...
customer_reviews.text: this camera is amazing i love the sharpness the super quick autofocus built like a tank and rated the best DLSR Dx camera . If you are a Pro or want to step up your photography you have the Nikon D7100.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Heard

customer_reviews.title: Great Image Quality - But not a Pro Build
customer_reviews.text: The D7100 has great image quality but the feel of the camera is cheap and light like you'de expect in their consumer models. Nikon changed some of the control button features just enough to annoy you a little until you get used to them. But the ISO capability is tremendously better than the D300s I was shooting for years. I gained a full 2-3 stops with this camera. Even at the higher ISO's the noise is finer and less noticeable because of the resolution. The shutter noise is remarkably quieter as well. Putting aside the cheap build - I think the camera is a winner over all.
customer_reviews.author: John V. Adamski

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've had the camera body now for a couple of months. Stepping up to the D7100 from a D50 was a huge step and it has taken more time than I had imagined to feel comfortable with all of the controls. However, I can say without hesitation that the time invested in learning the D7100 has been well worth the time. Pictures are simply stellar. Video is also very good although I don't have much to compare it to. I am simply thrilled with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: love it, I'll have it for a while.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera, great quality photos and huge file sizes. I was apprehensive about getting such an expensive product left outside at my house... And the mail man did leave it in the rain, and not under my covered porch, but it was wrapped up nicely and there was no damage. And no one stole it, YAY! I YouTube instructions, and I felt good bout us in it after a couple days playing around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pearly Elvira

customer_reviews.title: Great Features!  Great Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: There are so many features with camera, I've only just begun to scratch the surface. I upgraded from a D80 and was happy to see that the menu options on the D7100 were listed in a similar format as before. So, my learning curve for navigating around the menus was very quick. But there are far more options like storing your settings and using predefined modes. I still have much to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Papatone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: The camera body was received sooner than estimated, which was super nice. I have had no problems with this DSLR body, and this is my main shooter and I use it almost daily. Very little to no scratches on the outside, and all the components work like new. The seller was so kind as to even include an adapter for wireless photo transfer for free. I highly recommend this product and this seller!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I was looking to swap my Nikon D2x into a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to swap my Nikon D2x into a backup role and needed something that can keep up with my shooting as my main body. The Nikon D7100 has been that camera! Once you get the settings tweaked to your liking and understand all the programming/setup this camera kills it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: loved it from the very first test picture
customer_reviews.text: Moved from D90 to D7100, loved it from the very first test picture. No regrets and extremely happy with its handling of tone curves in all lighting conditions, especially indoors with human skin tones. Lots of features I knew I wanted, and many other pleasant surprises. If you are thinking of it, buy it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Vic S. Shahid

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT camera! This is the best camera that is a non full frame DSLR. I've owned Nikon's for many years. This is the best Nikon I've ever had. The camera is easy to use, but I'm still learning about the many powerful capabilities that this camera possesses.
customer_reviews.author: Marula

customer_reviews.title: Shoot forever with battery grip and two card slots..
customer_reviews.text: With 24.1 MP and two SD card slots I can shoot pictures forever. Still learning all the features of this camera. This was an upgrade from my D5000 and well worth the $$. Video mode is easy and the continual auto focus makes movie taking easy. Also features two shooting modes of DX and 1.3. Recommend buying one of the popular books by professionals all about this particular camera instead of trying to stumble through the manual that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade from the Nikon D5100 and did a lot of research on what camera would be best. The D7100 came out on top and it definitely shows why. You will not be disappointed with this camera and since its been out for a while the price is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Nate and Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome new camera at a great price !
customer_reviews.text: Great product Adorama Camera, it's exactly as described and my wife is seriously stoked. Thank you Amazon, & Adorama Camera for a wonderful product. Sincerely, Troy Velez
customer_reviews.author: Troy Velez

customer_reviews.title: One of the Greatest Cameras Ever Built
customer_reviews.text: If you read up on this camera, this is one of the best cameras you can buy for under a thousand bucks. The video isn't great but it handles ISO well, quick autofocus, good color depth and such. Produces great pictures, I use a Sigma 150-600mm, a Nikon 35mm 1.8, and the 70-300 and 18-55 that come with it. Here are some pictures that highlight the cameras ability.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sonpal

customer_reviews.title: Like all my Nikons I love it...
customer_reviews.text: I won't give up my D7000 but now I have two FX and two DX bodies. It most comfortable with a smaller profile and a small learning curve. And the photos/photo files are top shelf. Mine spit oil on the sensor already but ZI have come to accept that happening as it not limited to Nikon cameras and the entire industry needs to address this problem and do a bit of preventative engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Edward G. Dickau

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With This Combo
customer_reviews.text: I have been checking out this camera for the past year. I also read countless professional reviews and talked with friends who have this camera body. I finally broke down and purchased - giving my older Nikon DSLR to my daughter. I think this camera also does the laundry and cleans windows. The lens is a very good match for this camera as well.
customer_reviews.author: fas

customer_reviews.title: Amazon you made it so easy to own.
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I was a young lad, I have enjoyed photography, so much that I eventually pursued and obtained a Teaching Certificate in Photography. I used a Nikon HP 3 for many years and when the digital concept was introducted I purchased a digital camera. I upgraded to the best and so I purchased a Nikon D-80 and loved it. My recent purchase was the D7100, and I must tell you that it is a fantastic camera, the operation and applications are just what I was looking for. I love everything about it. Thanks to Amazon I got a great deal on my D7100. A. Saenz CEO Rio D. Brazos Communications
customer_reviews.author: Adolph Saenz

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an inexpensive intermediate camera that would be a jump up from my entry level nikon, but still budget-friendly. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E

customer_reviews.title: Solid and professionally built
customer_reviews.text: Solid and in excellent condition, it works beautifully. Despite being much heavier and larger than many others, I’m glad I made the purchase and I would recommend it to any one who wants a solid camera but who can cope with its weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon P.

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D7100 replacement of Nikon D90 an obvious upgrade of functionality and automaticity
customer_reviews.text: I have had a D90 for a number of years and had a great experience with that camera but the D7100 certain is all that other reviews have shown to be a great replacement and is in my opinion much more responsive to my picture taking needs. I would definitely recommend this camera for anyone trying to decide to replace the older model Nikon in my case a D90.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nunan

customer_reviews.title: The camera arrived on time and it works perfectly. ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived on time and it works perfectly. I especially appreciate the Nikon battery (not a second-party knockoff) that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: DonD99362

customer_reviews.title: The best camera I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I use the the camera professionally to create training videos. The quality is amazing. I purchased a 50mm prime lens in conjunction with the camera. Together, the hardware exposes the weaknesses in my video editing abilities. The quality of the final product is better than necessary for an 800 location restaurant brand to post training videos on YouTube. I do not expect to need a better camera, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Diabolicus

customer_reviews.title: I finally got my Nikon
customer_reviews.text: Great camera ! I've had my eye on a top-shelf Nikon for 2 decades ..... I've finally gotten it. This is an amazing camera with capabilities that we are still learning. Well Done Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Katie and Gary

customer_reviews.title: What can I say but "Wow". This all you ...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say but "Wow". This all you will ever need in a DX camera body. Just wish that I could afford another one. Everything and more for the price. Thanks Nikon. You've done well.
customer_reviews.author: KentuckyRifle

customer_reviews.title: My Baby
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through many Nikons, and this one is my favorite. I've had the D70, D200, and D700. Although these cameras take beautiful pictures and are more oriented to experienced photographers, they are older and Don't have video recording capability. I wanted this camera for this exact reason. It may not be as sharp as the D800 but this is a more cheaper, more user friendly, and lighter in weight. It has more MP than my previous cameras. I have had this camera for about a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. The photos come out really detailed and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. The photos come out really detailed and there's a ton of room for customizations. I've been using it for scenery photos and they look gorgeous. My only real gripe is that the button to change the priority modes requires you press a button before turning the dial which can be annoying to do sometimes but other than that, superb camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: At current used prices these are an excellent value. The 24 MP sensor with no anti-aliasing filter provides a significant upgrade in image quality over the D7000, and ergonomics are improved as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen SmithTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It is the best for me! I am happy!
customer_reviews.text: Wooow it is the best!! wonderfull! focusing is the best! High ISO on low light is great! ... all all is great!!! I am from Ecuador and I am very happy with my D7100 for working and for all!
customer_reviews.author: Lenin Matamoros C

product_meta.title: Nikon D7100 24.1 MP DX-Format CMOS Digital SLR (Body Only)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseFROM THE MANUFACTURER



Unleash the power of Nikon's DX-format HD-SLR system.
Meet the new flagship of Nikon's outstanding DX-format HD-SLR line-up: the D7100. Incorporating recent advancements in HD-SLR technology, the D7100 brings a thrilling new level of image quality, speed, connectivity and creative capabilities—a specially designed 24.1-megapixel DX-format image sensor, superior low-light performance, ultra-precise autofocus and metering, advanced video recording features, built-in HDR, mobile connectivity and much, much more. Pair it with any of Nikon's superb NIKKOR DX- and FX-format lenses, versatile Speedlights and accessories, and the D7100 will be the centerpiece of your creativity for years to come.






CAPTURE EVERY DETAIL TRUE TO LIFE
PURE, SHARP IMAGES
The D7100 marks an exciting advancement in image quality for high-resolution DX-format cameras. Nikon specially designed its 24.1-megapixel DX-format CMOS sensor without using an optical low pass filter (OLPF), resulting in the purest, sharpest images using D7100's DX-format CMOS sensor. Combine that with fantastic ISO performance at both ends of the spectrum—down to ISO 100 and up to ISO 6400—the processing speed and intelligence of EXPEED 3 and the extra lens reach of a 1.5x crop factor, and the D7100 is the ultimate tool for those seeking a lightweight DX-format HD-SLR.

SPEED AND PRECISION IN HARMONY
HIGH-SPEED SHOOTING WITH FLAWLESS METERING AND AUTOFOCUS
When the action speeds up, fire a blazing fast 6 frames per second continuously for up to 100 shots. Building on the acclaimed autofocus system from the D300s, the D7100 uses 51 focus points, including 15 cross-type sensors for detecting both vertical and horizontal contrast variations, to achieve fast, precise focus. The central cross-type sensor works all the way down to f/8, a huge advantage when using compatible teleconverters. At the same time, a highly accurate 2016-pixel RGB sensor evaluates every scene, taking into account brightness, contrast, subject distance and color, for spot-on auto operations like Face-Priority and full-time autofocus during video capture.

WIRELESS SHARING AND CONTROL
COMPATIBLE WITH THE WU-1A WIRELESS MOBILE ADAPTER
The D7100 makes it easy to share your great photos immediately, wherever you are. Connect the optional WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter and instantly transfer shots to a compatible smartphone or tablet, then upload them to the web, send by email or text—share them however you like. With Nikon's free Wireless Mobile Utility installed on your smartphone or tablet (available for both Android and iOS), you can also remotely control the D7100. Use your phone or tablet as a Live View monitor to take shots without having the camera in your hands, a huge advantage for everything from self portraits to digiscoping with a Nikon fieldscope.





CREATE MOVIES THAT AMAZE
DAZZLING 1080P VIDEOS, SLOW-MOTION AND TIME-LAPSE SEQUENCES
With full-time autofocus and manual exposure control during video recording, a built-in stereo mic and an external stereo mic jack, headphone and HDMI jacks, the D7100 achieves exceptional cinematic reproduction and quality. Record in several high-definition formats: 1080p at 60i/50i/30/25/24 fps or 720p at up to 60p for ultra-smooth slow-motion sequences. Dual SD card slots give you additional recording time, and an all new 60i function enables smooth playback on HDTVs or external monitors. And, of course, every shot looks great through a NIKKOR lens. Create beautiful background blur with the AF-S DX NIKKOR 35mm f/1.8G, or use the AF-S DX NIKKOR 10-24mm for an ultra-wide-angle view that's perfect for establishing shots and working in tight interiors.



PREMIUM ACCESSORIES



WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter 
Using the WU-1a optional wireless mobile adapter you can now automatically send great images to your smartphone and even use your smartphone to remotely capture images from your D7100. With an easy to use app, now when you can't wait to share that great shot you don't have to. Share it to your smartphone in a instant. Nikon EN-EL15 Rechargeable Li-Ion Battery 
These rechargeable batteries provide extended life and consistent power, even in colder conditions. MB-D15 Multi-Power Battery Pack 
The MB-D15 is equipped with a shutter-release button, AE/AF lock button, multi selector, and main- and sub-command dials for improved operation when taking photographs with the camera vertically oriented. ME-1 Stereo Microphone 
Record crystal-clear sound and significantly reduce autofocus noise on your compatible DSLR camera using this compact stereo microphone. The ME-1 Stereo Microphone connects to compatible DSLR cameras that have a 3.5mm Mic jack and features new innovation that significantly reduces autofocus noise from being recorded.
